overview:
Tushar earned his B.S. in Management from Purdue Universityâ€™s Krannert School of Management, and currently resides in San Francisco.

In January 2006, Tushar relocated to Mountain View, California, to join Google as a Quantitative Analyst. After three years at US Headquarters, he was placed on a two-year international assignment in Singapore (Googleâ€™s Asia-Pacific headquarters), to manage the strategy, design, and implementation of Googleâ€™s Sales Compensation Analytics function. Additionally, he worked as a Sales Strategist with revenue responsibility across the Southeast Asian market (Singapore, Malaysia, and Indonesia).

He is currently a Business Development Manager at Google, supporting the TV, Video, and YouTube Ads businesses out of the San Francisco office.

He continues his relationship with Purdue through his active membership as the President of the Purdue Alumni Associationâ€™s San Francisco Bay Area chapter. In addition, he was selected as a Keynote Speaker on the Krannert Executive Forum at Purdue Universityâ€™s business school.

He also has a wide breadth of experience across different industries having served in these capacities:

* Broadcom Corp. - Global Rewards 
* Caterpillar Inc. - Technical Marketing 
* Amgen Inc. - Corporate Finance 
* Ford Motor Company - Strategy and Business Development 
* Enterprise Rent-A-Car - Sales & Marketing

In addition to his professional achievements, he is also an active member of the community. He helped labor the salvation of disadvantaged youth and families in Gujarat, India, (through educational tutoring and mentorship). He recently has been involved in academic tutoring and coaching tennis to inner-city youths surrounding the San Francisco Bay Area. A formerly ranked tennis player, he is an avid member of the United States Tennis Associationâ€™s California Section. In 2010, he was named one of Purdue University’s “40 under 40” Distinguished Alumni list.
